2312560.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312560
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 001
2312560.text: Ja'far ibn Abi'l-Mughira said, "Sa'id ibn Jubayr stayed with me and said tht Ibn 'Abbas related to me that he used to say, 'Where are those who play with gambling arrows for the slaughtered camel? They buy a camel with ten shares. Then they shuffle the arrows and it becomes nine shares and they continue until comes down to one share. The others lose their shares to the one share. That is gambling (arrow-shuffling).'"

2312570.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312570
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 002

2312580.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312580
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 003
2312580.text: Rabi'a ibn 'Abdullah ibn al-Hadir ibn 'Abdullah reported tht two men wagered two cocks in the time of 'Umar. 'Umar ordered that the cock be killed and a man of the Ansar said to him, "Will you kill a something which glorifies Allah?" So 'Umar left it.

2312590.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312590
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 004
2312590.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If any of you makes an oath and swears in his oath by al-Lat and al-'Uzza should say, 'There is no god but Allah.' If any of you tells him companion, 'Come on, I will make a bet with you' should give sadaqa."

2312600.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312600
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 005
2312600.text: Husayn ibn Mus'ab reported that someone told Abu Hurayra, "We wager two pigeons and we do not want for there to be a third unwagered pigeon between them so that the unwagered pigeon might take the winnings." Abu Hurayra said, "That is how children behave. You are at the point where you should abandon that."

2312610.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312610
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 006
2312610.text: It is related tht al-Bara' ibn Malik used to do the camel-chant for the men and Anjasha used to do the camel-chant for the women. He had a good voice and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anjasha, be gentle when you drive the glass-vessels."

2312620.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312620
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 007
2312620.text: Ibn 'Abbas said that the words of Allah in Luqman (35:6), "There are people who trade in distracting tales" mean "singing and things like it."

2312630.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312630
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 008
2312630.text: Al-Bara' ibn 'Azib reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Extend the greeting and you will be safe. The saw is evil."

2312640.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312640
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 009
2312640.text: Salman al-Ilhani reported that Fadala ibn 'Ubayd was in a gathering. He heard that some people were playing backgammon. He got up in anger and forbade it in the strongest possible terms. Then he said, "Anyone who plays it in order to consume its winnings is like someone who eats pig meat and does wudu' with blood."

2312650.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312650
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 010
2312650.text: Al-Fadil ibn Muslim reported that his father said, "When 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, went out through the Bab al-Qasr, he saw some backgammon players. He took them and locked them up from morning to night. Some of them he only locked up for half the day. Those he locked up until night were those who used silver. Those he locked up for half the day were those who played it. He also commanded that they should not be greeted."

2312660.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312660
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 011
2312660.text: Abu Musa al-Ash'ari reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who plays backgammon has rebelled against Allah and His Messenger."

2312670.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312670
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 012
2312670.text: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud said, "Beware of these two marked cubes. They should be forcibly prohibited. They are part of gambling."

2312680.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312680
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 013
2312680.text: Burayda reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Someone who plays backgammon is like a person who puts his hand in the meat and blood of a pig."

2312690.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312690
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 014
2312690.text: Abu Musa reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who plays backgammon has rebelled against Allah and His Messenger."

2312700.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312700
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 015
2312700.text: Nafi' related that if 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar found any of his family playing backgammon, he would beat them and break the board.

2312710.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312710
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 016
2312710.text: 'Alqama ibn Abi 'Alqama reported from his mother that 'A'isha, may Allah be pleased with her, heard that some people living in a room in her house had a backgammon game. She sent to them, saying, "If you do not remove it, I will evict you from my house." He censured them for playing that.

2312720.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312720
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 017
2312720.text: Kulthum ibn Jabir said, "Ibn az-Zubayr addressed us and said, 'People of Makka, I have heard that there are men of Quraysh who play a game called backgammon. It is done with the left hand. Allah says, 'Wine and gambling.' (5:90) I swear by Allah that if anyone who plays it is brought before me, I will punish him in his hair and skin, and I will give his booty to the one who brings him to me."

2312730.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312730
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 018
2312730.text: Ya'la ibn Murra reported that he heard Abu Hurayra speaking about someone who plays backgammon and bets on it, saying that he is like someone who eats pig meat and that the person who plays it without betting on it is like someone who washes his hands in pig's blood. The person who sits looking at it is like someone who looks at pig's meat.

2312740.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312740
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 019
2312740.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr ibn al-'As said, "Someone who plays dice for a bet is like a person who eats pig meat. Someone who plays it without betting is like someone who washes his hands in pig's blood."

2312750.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312750
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 020
2312750.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "A believer is not hurt by the same stone twice."

2312760.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312760
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 021
2312760.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who shoots at night is not one of us."

2312770.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312770
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 022
2312770.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who bears arms against us is not one of us."

2312780.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312780
In-book reference  : Book 54, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 54, Hadith 023
2312780.text: Same hadith as 1280, but from Abu Musa.
